name: Citrine Sleet TTPs
description: Mitigating indicators for Citrine Sleet according to ATT&CK v14 & Navigator v4.9.1

techniques.comment: The text mentioned that threat actors downloaded shellcode containing a sandbox escape exploit and the FudModule rootkit, which indicates process injection.
The threat actor exploited a Chromium vulnerability (CVE-2024-7971) to gain initial access by directing targets to a controlled domain.
Microsoft noted that the threat actor used a secure AES-encrypted connection with the command and control server
The text mentioned that the FudModule rootkit performs kernel tampering through a kernel read/write primitive indicating a system image modification.

The text describes how the threat group engaged in extensive reconnaissance of the cryptocurrency industry and individuals associated with it, creating fake websites masquerading as legitimate cryptocurrency trading platforms.
Microsoft mentioned that Citrine Sleet used social engineering tactics to lure targets into downloading a weaponized cryptocurrency wallet or trading application based on legitimate applications.
